metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6420 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The wwunpack function in libclamav/wwunpack.c in ClamAV 0.99.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (use-after-free) via a crafted PE file with WWPack compression.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-base - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-daemon - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-freshclam - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-milter - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamav-testfiles - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
clamdscan - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libclamav7 - 0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.2+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
